Pitch%.definition: Pitch type usage / total pitches thrown

AB.definition: Total At-Bats: PA - BB - HBP - SAC - SF

WHIP.definition: Walks plus hits per inning pitched

BABIP.definition: Batting Average on Balls in Play

wOBA.definition: Weighted On-Base Average: crediting a hitter for the value of each outcome, i.e. single, double, etc., rather than treating all hits or times on base equally

xwOBA.definition: Expected Weighted On-Base Average: crediting a hitter for the value of each outcome (expected for batted balls), i.e. single, double, etc., rather than treating all hits or times on base equally

wRAA.definition: Weighted Runs Above Average: the number of offensive runs a player contributes to their team compared to the average player at their level

wRC+.definition: Weighted Runs Created +: Quantifying a player's total offensive value and measuring it by runs before scaling league average to equal 100

Pull.definition: Percentage of balls in play hit to the batter's pull side

Middle.definition: Percentage of balls in play hit to the middle of the field

Oppo.definition: Percentage of balls in play hit to the batter's opposite field side

FB%.definition: Fly Ball Rate (no. of fly balls/batted balls)

LD%.definition: Line Drive Rate (no. of line drives/batted balls)

EV.definition: Average Exit Velocity on batted balls

EV 90.definition: 90th Percentile Exit Velocity on batted balls (min. 0° launch angle)

Max EV.definition: Highest Exit Velocity Batted Ball (min. 0° launch angle)

LA.definition: Average Launch Angle on Batted Balls

HH%.definition: Percentage of batted balls with a 95 mph exit velocity or higher (Softball - 65 mph)

HH LA.definition: Average launch angle on hard hit batted balls, i.e. 95 mph exit velocity or higher (Softball - 65 mph)

Barrel%.definition: Percentage of batted balls that were barreled based on their EV/LA combo

SwSpot%.definition: Sweet spot percentage, i.e. percentage of batted balls with a launch angle between 8 and 32 degrees

Spin Axis.definition: Direction in which the ball is spinning, reported in degrees of tilt

iVB.definition: Induced Vertical Break: The amount of vertical movement a pitch experiences due to the spin imparted on the ball, measured in inches, controlling for gravity

HB.definition: Horizontal Break: The amount of lateral movement a pitch experiences due to the spin imparted on the ball, measured in inches. A positive number means the breaks was to the right from the pitcher's perspective, while negative is breaking to the left

Vert Appr.definition: Verical Approach Angle: angle at which the pitch crosses home plate (i.e., how steep or flat the pitch is)

Horz Appr.definition: Horizontal Spproach Angle: The angle at which the ball crosses the plate laterally. Pitches moving to the right from the pitcher's perspective will have a positive HAA

Extension.definition: Distance from home plate from which the pitcher releases the ball relative to the rubber

RelHeight.definition: Vertical height from which the pitcher releases the ball relative to the rubber

RelSide.definition: Horizontal distance from which the pitcher releases the ball relative to the rubber

Strike%.definition: Percentage of pitches thrown for strikes

Zone%.definition: Percentage of pitches within the strike zone

Shadow%.definition: Percentage of pitches within the shadow zone (the edges of the strike zone)

Heart%.definition: Percentage of pitches within the heart of the plate

Swing%.definition: Percentage of total pitches swung at

Z-Swing%.definition: Total swings on pitches inside the zone / total pitches inside the zone

Contact%.definition: Total pitches on which contact was made / total swings

Z-Contact%.definition: Total pitches on which contact was made inside the zone / total swings on pitches inside the zone

O-Contact%.definition: Total pitches on which contact was made outside the zone / total swings on pitches outside the zone

Chase%.definition: Total pitches swung at outside the zone / total pitches seen outside the zone

Z-Whiff%.definition: Total swing-and-misses inside the zone / total swings inside the zone

Put Away%.definition: Rate of two-strike pitches that result in a strikeout

FIP.definition: Fielding Independent Pitching: Estimating a pitcher's run prevention independent of defense

xFIP.definition: Expected Fielding Independent Pitching: Estimating a pitcher's run prevention independent of defense while also normalizing HR/FB%

SIERA.definition: Skill-Interactive ERA: Attempting to model the underlying skill level of a pitcher

SPD.definition: Speed score, between 1 (slowest) and 10 (fastest) with 5 being average speed

SD+.definition: Swing Decision+: Grading swing decisions independent of results. (league avg. = 100)

Stuff+.definition: Grading pitch quality solely on physical factors of Stuff (e.g., velo, spin, movement, etc.) - quantifying nastiness compared to all other pitch types

Command+.definition: Grading pitch quality solely on location, independent of any factors of Stuff, compared to all other pitch types

xRV+.definition: Expected Run Value+: Grading pitch quality in totality with factors of Stuff, Command, and Deception compared to all other pitch types

pStuff+.definition: Stuff+, but relative to pitches of the same type

pCommand+.definition: Command+, but relative to pitches of the same type

pxRV+.definition: xRV+, but relative to pitches of the same type

Anomaly+.definition: A factor of deception included in xRV. Grading how unique a pitcher's release traits & approach angles they create are

Tunnel+.definition: A factor of deception included in xRV. Comparing pitch trajectories (ratio of location at hitter's decision point to where the pitch crosses the plate) to quantify pitch tunneling

PredMovDiff+.definition: A factor of deception included in xRV. Comparing a pitch's movement characteristics to what's expected given his release traits. Those that can deviate from what's expected are more deceptive

E+A%.definition: Early + Ahead: BIP% on 3 pitches or less + % PA where a 0-2 or 1-2 count is achieved
